Biology_415.News Finding: With whey pre-load, insulin and GLP-1 responses also were significantly higher (105 and 141 percent, respectively), producing a 96 percent increase in early insulin response.
Biology_415.Paper Finding: Plasma insulin levels at the first 30 min were higher and increased more rapidly after whey pre-load (Fig.
Biology_415.News Context: The researchers found that glucose levels were reduced by 28 percent after the whey pre-load over the 180-minute post-meal period, with a uniform reduction during early and late phases. With whey pre-load, insulin and GLP-1 responses also were significantly higher (105 and 141 percent, respectively), producing a 96 percent increase in early insulin response. "The early insulin response that usually is deficient in type-2 diabetes was significantly higher after whey protein than with placebo, and the whey protein preload significantly reduced the elevation of blood glucose after breakfast," said Prof. Jakubowicz.
Biology_415.Paper Context: Whey protein significantly increased the postprandial early insulin release. Plasma insulin levels at the first 30 min were higher and increased more rapidly after whey pre-load (Fig. Over the late interval, AUC 60-120 min , and during the complete post-meal period (0-180 min), plasma insulin levels were also significantly higher after whey preload than after placebo (Fig.

Biology_411.News Finding: Across all four cancer types, the new method of selecting candidate genes based on inter-tumor variation in gene expression outperformed the other methods, including the standard method of comparing mean expression in adjacent normal and tumor tissues.
Biology_411.Paper Finding: Our study showed that assessment of the interindividual variation of gene expression is better at predicting cancer-associated genes than is the traditional comparison of mean gene expression in adjacent normal and tumor tissues.
Biology_411.News Context: The results were consistent across 4 major cancer types: breast, colorectal, lung, and prostate cancer. Across all four cancer types, the new method of selecting candidate genes based on inter-tumor variation in gene expression outperformed the other methods, including the standard method of comparing mean expression in adjacent normal and tumor tissues. The authors cite tumor heterogeneity as the most likely reason for the success of their variance-based approach.
Biology_411.Paper Context: The average EF was slightly lower for the raw data than was it was for the processed data: 3.5 ± 0.3 vs. 3.8 ± 0.2, even though the correlation between the raw-data variance and the processed-data variance was relatively low: average, 0.52; range, 0.31 to 0.62. Our study showed that assessment of the interindividual variation of gene expression is better at predicting cancer-associated genes than is the traditional comparison of mean gene expression in adjacent normal and tumor tissues. The results were consistent for 4 major cancer types: breast, colorectal, lung, and prostate cancer.
Biology_411.text:
['Finding A: Across all four cancer types, the new method of selecting candidate genes based on inter-tumor variation in gene expression outperformed the other methods, including the standard method of comparing mean expression in adjacent normal and tumor tissues.
Finding B: Our study showed that assessment of the interindividual variation of gene expression is better at predicting cancer-associated genes than is the traditional comparison of mean gene expression in adjacent normal and tumor tissues.']
Biology_411.displayed_text:
Finding A: Across all four cancer types, the new method of selecting candidate genes based on inter-tumor variation in gene expression outperformed the other methods, including the standard method of comparing mean expression in adjacent normal and tumor tissues.
Finding B: Our study showed that assessment of the interindividual variation of gene expression is better at predicting cancer-associated genes than is the traditional comparison of mean gene expression in adjacent normal and tumor tissues.

Biology_tweet_181.News Finding: Sic1 makes sick in a new time zone: pill for jet lag not far  @username @username @username @username
Biology_tweet_181.Paper Finding: As SIK1 acts to suppress the effects of light on the clock, this pathway provides a pharmacological target for the treatment of disturbed circadian rhythms, including jet lag, shift-work, and illnesses that disturb circadian timing.
Biology_tweet_181.News Context: Sic1 makes sick in a new time zone: pill for jet lag not far  @username @username @username @username
Biology_tweet_181.Paper Context: Critically, we show that knockdown of Sik1 within the SCN results in extended light-induced phase shifts and an enhanced rate of re-entrainment to an advanced LD cycle. As SIK1 acts to suppress the effects of light on the clock, this pathway provides a pharmacological target for the treatment of disturbed circadian rhythms, including jet lag, shift-work, and illnesses that disturb circadian timing. Surprisingly, the majority (81%, 436 genes) of transcripts were downregulated in response to light, with a smaller number of genes showing upregulation (19%, 100 genes).

['Finding A: Sic1 makes sick in a new time zone: pill for jet lag not far @username @username @username @username
Finding B: As SIK1 acts to suppress the effects of light on the clock, this pathway provides a pharmacological target for the treatment of disturbed circadian rhythms, including jet lag, shift-work, and illnesses that disturb circadian timing.']

Finding A: Sic1 makes sick in a new time zone: pill for jet lag not far @username @username @username @username

Biology_tweet_24.Paper Context: Comparing the magnitudes of difference between subsistence groups and geographic groups, we therefore find that the bacterial compositional difference between Tanzania and Botswana (a geographic grouping) is larger than between any of the African subsistence groups (both unweighted and weighted UniFrac F-statistics). Biology_403.News Finding: In this case, the goats did not learn the task faster.
Biology_403.Paper Finding: We suggest that wild and domestic goats, and possibly other ungulates, lack sophisticated forms of social learning, because individual and simple social learning mechanisms are probably more efficient for improving their survival or reproductive success .
Biology_403.News Context: After subjecting them to a few demonstrations most of the trained goats (9/12) successfully learned the task; "on average, within 12 trials," according to the authors. In this case, the goats did not learn the task faster. This goes to show that goats "learned through individual rather than social learning," researchers noted in their paper.
Biology_403.Paper Context: In Krueger and Flauger , the side at which a demonstrator was eating influenced the behaviour of observers if the demonstrator was present (i.e. We suggest that wild and domestic goats, and possibly other ungulates, lack sophisticated forms of social learning, because individual and simple social learning mechanisms are probably more efficient for improving their survival or reproductive success . Alternatively, this lack of social learning could be linked to domestication, following the relaxed dependency on conspecifics, as has been suggested for dogs .
Biology_403.text:
['Finding A: In this case, the goats did not learn the task faster.
Finding B: We suggest that wild and domestic goats, and possibly other ungulates, lack sophisticated forms of social learning, because individual and simple social learning mechanisms are probably more efficient for improving their survival or reproductive success .']

Finding B: We suggest that wild and domestic goats, and possibly other ungulates, lack sophisticated forms of social learning, because individual and simple social learning mechanisms are probably more efficient for improving their survival or reproductive success .

Biology_40.News Finding: The study found that, on average, Bifidobacterium were established earlier and more frequently in infants fed by women with an active copy of the gene, the secretors, than without one, the non-secretors.
Biology_40.Paper Finding: Bifidobacteria were found to be established (High-Bif qPCR ) earlier in secretorfed infants (60% of infants versus 37.5% at day 6) and more often (80% versus 50% by day 120) ( Figure 5 ).
Biology_40.News Context: The relationship between human genetics, breast milk and Bifidobacterium appears to have developed throughout mammalian evolution. The study found that, on average, Bifidobacterium were established earlier and more frequently in infants fed by women with an active copy of the gene, the secretors, than without one, the non-secretors. The authors found that the intestinal tracts of infants fed by non-secretor mothers are delayed in establishing a bifidobacteria-dominated microbiota.
Biology_40.Paper Context: Much of the bifidobacterial abundance difference between the two secretor status milk phenotypes appears to come from variation in the time at which each infant transitions from possessing a Low-Bif qPCR ' gut community to possessing a High-Bif qPCR gut community. Bifidobacteria were found to be established (High-Bif qPCR ) earlier in secretorfed infants (60% of infants versus 37.5% at day 6) and more often (80% versus 50% by day 120) ( Figure 5 ). Of 35 milks from non-secretors, 20 of the matched infant stool samples were Low-Bif qPCR (57.1%).
Biology_40.text:
['Finding A: The study found that, on average, Bifidobacterium were established earlier and more frequently in infants fed by women with an active copy of the gene, the secretors, than without one, the non-secretors.
Finding B: Bifidobacteria were found to be established (High-Bif qPCR ) earlier in secretorfed infants (60% of infants versus 37.5% at day 6) and more often (80% versus 50% by day 120) ( Figure 5 ).']
Biology_40.displayed_text:
Finding A: The study found that, on average, Bifidobacterium were established earlier and more frequently in infants fed by women with an active copy of the gene, the secretors, than without one, the non-secretors.
Finding B: Bifidobacteria were found to be established (High-Bif qPCR ) earlier in secretorfed infants (60% of infants versus 37.5% at day 6) and more often (80% versus 50% by day 120) ( Figure 5 ).

Biology_tweet_9.News Finding: It's raining #viruses: "each day some 800 million viruses cascade onto every square meter of the planet", study published at the @username says. Also, viral deposition rates were 9 to 461 times greater than for #bacteria
Biology_tweet_9.Paper Finding: These deposition rates were 9-461 times greater than the rates for bacteria, which ranged from 0.3 × 10 7 to >8 × 10 7 m −2 per day.
Biology_tweet_9.News Context: It's raining #viruses: "each day some 800 million viruses cascade onto every square meter of the planet", study published at the @username says. Also, viral deposition rates were 9 to 461 times greater than for #bacteria
Biology_tweet_9.Paper Context: Here, we demonstrate that even in pristine environments, above the atmospheric boundary layer, the downward flux of viruses ranged from 0.26 × 10 9 to >7 × 10 9 m −2 per day. These deposition rates were 9-461 times greater than the rates for bacteria, which ranged from 0.3 × 10 7 to >8 × 10 7 m −2 per day. The highest relative deposition rates for viruses were associated with atmospheric transport from marine rather than terrestrial sources.
Biology_tweet_9.text:
['Finding A: It\'s raining #viruses: "each day some 800 million viruses cascade onto every square meter of the planet", study published at the @username says. Also, viral deposition rates were 9 to 461 times greater than for #bacteria
Finding B: These deposition rates were 9-461 times greater than the rates for bacteria, which ranged from 0.3 × 10 7 to >8 × 10 7 m −2 per day.']
Biology_tweet_9.displayed_text:
Finding A: It's raining #viruses: "each day some 800 million viruses cascade onto every square meter of the planet", study published at the @username says. Also, viral deposition rates were 9 to 461 times greater than for #bacteria
Finding B: These deposition rates were 9-461 times greater than the rates for bacteria, which ranged from 0.3 × 10 7 to >8 × 10 7 m −2 per day.

Biology_310.News Finding: "The work by Petry and co-workers now shows that XMAP215, previously considered a microtubule 'polymerase' involved in microtubule elongation, acts synergistically with g-tubulin to promote efficient microtubule nucleation.
Biology_310.Paper Finding: In this study, we demonstrate that XMAP215 is a bona fide MT nucleation factor that cooperates with γ -TuRC.
Biology_310.News Context: That search may now be over. "The work by Petry and co-workers now shows that XMAP215, previously considered a microtubule 'polymerase' involved in microtubule elongation, acts synergistically with g-tubulin to promote efficient microtubule nucleation. The work provides an answer to this critical puzzle in our understanding of microtubule regulation in the cell."
Biology_310.Paper Context: Furthermore, if XMAP215 were to function as a MT nucleator, its relationship with the universal nucleator γ -TuRC needs to be established and their mechanism determined 27,34,35 . In this study, we demonstrate that XMAP215 is a bona fide MT nucleation factor that cooperates with γ -TuRC. Using Xenopus egg extracts to resolve individual nucleation events, we show that XMAP215 determines the extent of MT nucleation in the cytoplasm.
Biology_310.text:
['Finding A: "The work by Petry and co-workers now shows that XMAP215, previously considered a microtubule \'polymerase\' involved in microtubule elongation, acts synergistically with g-tubulin to promote efficient microtubule nucleation.
Finding B: In this study, we demonstrate that XMAP215 is a bona fide MT nucleation factor that cooperates with γ -TuRC.']
Biology_310.displayed_text:
Finding A: "The work by Petry and co-workers now shows that XMAP215, previously considered a microtubule 'polymerase' involved in microtubule elongation, acts synergistically with g-tubulin to promote efficient microtubule nucleation.
Finding B: In this study, we demonstrate that XMAP215 is a bona fide MT nucleation factor that cooperates with γ -TuRC.

Biology_tweet_88.News Finding: Interesting study on effects of #neonicotinoid exposure & pollen diet on #bumblebee queen nest initiation in @username  Restricted diet impacts on queen & colony overshadowed by insecticide exposure, but monofloral pollen diet reduced brood numbers
Biology_tweet_88.Paper Finding: Here, we demonstrate that sublethal exposure to imidacloprid, a widely used neonicotinoid-type insecticide, has a broad suite of negative effects on early-nesting bumblebee queens.
Biology_tweet_88.News Context: Interesting study on effects of #neonicotinoid exposure & pollen diet on #bumblebee queen nest initiation in @username  Restricted diet impacts on queen & colony overshadowed by insecticide exposure, but monofloral pollen diet reduced brood numbers
Biology_tweet_88.Paper Context: Pollen diet was not an important driver of brood production overall, but among untreated queens, those fed monofloral Cistus pollen had significantly fewer larvae and pupae than queens fed mixed-source or monofloral Erica pollen ( p , 0.03 for counts of larvae and pupae). Here, we demonstrate that sublethal exposure to imidacloprid, a widely used neonicotinoid-type insecticide, has a broad suite of negative effects on early-nesting bumblebee queens. These effects were observed at the level of individual queens, who were less active and exhibited greater mortality when exposed to imidacloprid, but also at the colony level, where numbers of brood in the nest were dramatically reduced in treated queens, particularly when queens experienced sustained exposure to the insecticide.
Biology_tweet_88.text:
['Finding A: Interesting study on effects of #neonicotinoid exposure & pollen diet on #bumblebee queen nest initiation in @username Restricted diet impacts on queen & colony overshadowed by insecticide exposure, but monofloral pollen diet reduced brood numbers
Finding B: Here, we demonstrate that sublethal exposure to imidacloprid, a widely used neonicotinoid-type insecticide, has a broad suite of negative effects on early-nesting bumblebee queens.']
Biology_tweet_88.displayed_text:
Finding A: Interesting study on effects of #neonicotinoid exposure & pollen diet on #bumblebee queen nest initiation in @username Restricted diet impacts on queen & colony overshadowed by insecticide exposure, but monofloral pollen diet reduced brood numbers
Finding B: Here, we demonstrate that sublethal exposure to imidacloprid, a widely used neonicotinoid-type insecticide, has a broad suite of negative effects on early-nesting bumblebee queens.

Biology_tweet_0.Paper Finding: Our work demonstrates that wild birds can learn socially to recognize previously unfamiliar sounds as alarm calls.
Biology_tweet_0.Paper Context: Complementary studies of social learning in captivity would be useful in examining in detail the context in which different associations are formed. Our work demonstrates that wild birds can learn socially to recognize previously unfamiliar sounds as alarm calls. In our current experiment, learning could not be asocial because the unfamiliar sounds were never presented at the same time as predator models.
Biology_tweet_0.displayed_text:
Finding A: New @username paper showing that birds can learn socially to recognize heterospecific alarm calls by acoustic association with known alarm calls. DOI: @username @username @username @username
Finding B: Our work demonstrates that wild birds can learn socially to recognize previously unfamiliar sounds as alarm calls.

Biology_tweet_21.News Finding: Noise levels in the world's oceans are on the rise and this new study found that dolphins are simplifying their cal
Biology_tweet_21.Paper Finding: Consequently, the noiseinduced simplification of dolphin whistles may reduce the information content in these acoustic signals and decrease effective communication, parent -offspring proximity or group cohesion.
Biology_tweet_21.News Context: Noise levels in the world's oceans are on the rise and this new study found that dolphins are simplifying their cal
Biology_tweet_21.Paper Context: Increases in ship noise, both within and below the dolphins' call bandwidth, resulted in higher dolphin whistle frequencies and a reduction in whistle contour complexity, an acoustic feature associated with individual identification. Consequently, the noiseinduced simplification of dolphin whistles may reduce the information content in these acoustic signals and decrease effective communication, parent -offspring proximity or group cohesion. Vocal adjustments may compensate for increased ambient noise, but there may be constraints that limit this ability or ecological consequences to modified signals.
Biology_tweet_21.text:
['Finding A: Noise levels in the world\'s oceans are on the rise and this new study found that dolphins are simplifying their cal
Finding B: Consequently, the noiseinduced simplification of dolphin whistles may reduce the information content in these acoustic signals and decrease effective communication, parent -offspring proximity or group cohesion.']

Finding A: Noise levels in the world's oceans are on the rise and this new study found that dolphins are simplifying their cal
Finding B: Consequently, the noiseinduced simplification of dolphin whistles may reduce the information content in these acoustic signals and decrease effective communication, parent -offspring proximity or group cohesion.
